title: Stoneborn Pact - Does it work with % Heal increase effects?
body:
Pretty selfexplanatory question from the title...
The new Stoneborn Pact keystone mastery, im interested if it does or doesn't work with the % Healing and Shielding power increasing effects the likes of which we have on items such as {{item:3504}} Ardent Censer, {{item:3222}} Mikael's Crucible and {{item:3107}} Redemption? Or is it perhaps a different healing effect that isn't affected by these item effects?

replies.body: It does.
Probably a stupid question, but in order to amp the heal, the user of SBP needs to have forbidden idol, right? Not the one *recieving* the heals?
Not a stupid question at all. I'd like to know this as well. Is it the user's healing bonus that affects SBP, or the proccer?

{{item:3114}} boosts **outgoing** healing **from** your champion.

{{item:3065}} boosts any healing that affects **your own** champion.

The SBP user can increase the healing by buying Forbidden Idol upgrades, and the receiver can increase the benefit with Spirit Visage.

That's assuming how the heal applied to others is coded. However it's _probably_ coded as a heal _from the keystone holder_ because his own health increases the effect but I cannot assume for sure.

The Rioter comment implies the heal comes from the keystone holder but " It does" isn't very descriptive.

Rioter says {{item:3504}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3107}} does SBP increase healing. Since these items only increase healing that comes _from_ the champion using them, it follows that the SBP user increases healing from SBP by buying these items, not the receiver.

The only case where the receiver of the healing would increase said healing by buying these items is if the heal were spaghetti-coded to interpret a champion procing the healing rune as an _outward_ going heal that is _self_ targeted, which is contradictory, since the healing is not _outwards_ unless the healing targets _someone else_.
Yes. Details in my response to Frozen Sovereign.
So now Janna can heal and shield and soraka can heal with her Q?!

Yeah, but it is halved because they are ranged champions and you would need a **LOT** of HP to even see any meaningful benefits from it...

Im talking {{item:3107}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3143}} sort of HP...

So technically while you can use it on ranged champions such as Janna, Nami, Soraka etc. its much better off being used by melee tanky supports with some cc in their kits ala {{champion:12}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:44}} 
However, ranged supports do seem to have the benefit of ease of applying and keeping the mark up on as many enemies as possible, while the above mentioned melee supports seem to get benefits from it only for the brief moments after they cc a enemy ...
Aren't Alistar and Leona good CoC users? I probably think it will be better on Thresh or Blitz if you put it like that... But yeah I see the point on Janna/Soraka

Depends on the team comps/matchups.

CoC does wonders at making sure you don't lose much HP yourself, but doesn't benefit your ADC in the slightest. Way too often I've had to avoid fights because while I wouldn't personally lose the the trade, my ADC would. 

Stoneborn on the other hand means you have to be smarter about your own health, but can turn around trades where your ADC would have normally lost.

For example, I won a Leona/Ezreal vs Draven/Thresh because the constant CC made it possible for Ez to constantly sustain throughout the fight. Sure I took a bit more damage than I would have usually, but nothing game-changing as I wasn't focused (and shouldn't be), whereas I've seen many fights where my ADC's survival was solely due to Stoneborn.

It doesn't work on yourself, the tooltip for it explicitly states 
"Your crowd control effects brand enemy champions with a earthen rune for 4 seconds.
**_OTHER_** ally champions who attack branded enemies heal for 5 + 2.5% of your maximum health over 2 seconds (halved if you are ranged)."

So no, you yourself don't gain any benefits from attacking a branded enemy (Otherwise this would just end up being a support's Grasp of the Undying) but your other allies do heal off of it... 

About the "halved if you are ranged part"... would be nice to know which part of it is halved exactly... 
My guess it's the "5 + 2.5 % of your maximum health" that is halved for ranged champions, since it doesn't seem like the duration of the heal over time on allies is shorter for ranged users that apply this effect.

yeah we can read too, the question was if the "+increased healing and shielding" from above listed items increase the healing part of the keystone. also its the healing numbers that are halved not the duration (duration wouldn't make any sense).
I haven't tested it, but I assume that the healing doesn't get increased by those items. Instead, the healing received can be increased by Spirit Visage, Runic Armour etc.

It all comes down to whether healing received by attacking a marked champion is registered as Stoneborn Pact's user's healing or self-healing. This would also determine whose "healing" stat is bolstered in the end-game screen.

I would assume that too, i think i'll test this out myself in a custom game.

One interesting tid-bit about it is that Nami's E can apply it but you have to be the one applying the slow yourself (TL;DR you have to cast it on yourself and autoattack enemies with it to apply stoneborn's brand) so i guess it's tied to the champion that has the keystone itself...

However I am still trying to figure out if Frozen Heart procs StoneBorn as its technically a movement impaired item and it synergies with Torment.

{{item:3110}} Frozen Heart ?
I don't think it procs Stoneborn as the only thing it impairs is the enemy's Attack Speed by a set percentage...

However, items with slow effects such as {{item:3022}} Frozen Mallet, {{item:3116}} Rylai's Crystal Scepter and {{item:3030}} Hextech GLP-800 **_DO_** apply the Stoneborn brand on all affected enemy champions... This should further extend to any and all items that slow or impair** movement** of a enemy champion by any means necessary ({{item:3143}} ,{{item:3153}} ,{{item:3146}} etc.)
And does it work on yourself?
Yes it does. An Amumu with Rilay's and W toggled on will make you heal ridiculous ammounts of health.
